SEARCH
Package code_verification

Class CodeVerifier

java.lang.Object
code_verification.CodeVerifier
public class CodeVerifier extends Object
This class provides an implementation to try to compile and to run the tests of a maven based project located at the path given to its constructor.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    CodeVerifier(String projectFolderPath)
    The CodeVerifier constructor makes sure the given project folder path points to a valid maven projects

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    String
    getCompilationOutput()
    If the code has already been compiled, this returns the console output
    List<Document>
    getTestXml()
    If the tests have already been run, this returns the test result xml files
    boolean
    runTests()
    Tries to run all the tests in the folder previously given to the constructor This method relies on the maven library surefire to run JUnit tests This method is intended to be run only once since the result of the tests should be deterministic
    boolean
    verifyCompilation()
    Tries to compile the project in the folder given to the class constructor This method is intended to be run only once since the result of the compilation should be deterministic

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • CodeVerifier

      public CodeVerifier(String projectFolderPath)
      The CodeVerifier constructor makes sure the given project folder path points to a valid maven projects
      Parameters:
      projectFolderPath - the absolute path to the folder containing the project (a String)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the path points to no existing resource
      IllegalArgumentException - if the path points to a file instead of a folder
      IllegalArgumentException - if the path points to a folder that contains no pom.xml file

  • Method Details

    • verifyCompilation

      public boolean verifyCompilation() throws IOException, InterruptedException
      Tries to compile the project in the folder given to the class constructor This method is intended to be run only once since the result of the compilation should be deterministic
      Returns:
      true if the compilation did not return any error, false otherwise
      Throws:
      IOException - if the standard output of the process gets interrupted
      InterruptedException - if the subprocess compiling the source gets interrupted before completion
      IllegalStateException - if the method is called a second time on the same project

    • runTests

      public boolean runTests() throws IOException, InterruptedException
      Tries to run all the tests in the folder previously given to the constructor This method relies on the maven library surefire to run JUnit tests This method is intended to be run only once since the result of the tests should be deterministic
      Returns:
      true if every test succeeded, false otherwise
      Throws:
      IOException - if the standard output of the process gets interrupted
      InterruptedException - if the subprocess compiling the source gets interrupted before completion
      IllegalStateException - if the method is called a second time on the same project

    • getCompilationOutput

      public String getCompilationOutput()
      If the code has already been compiled, this returns the console output
      Returns:
      the console output of the maven compilation
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the project has not been compiled yet

    • getTestXml

      public List<Document> getTestXml()
      If the tests have already been run, this returns the test result xml files
      Returns:
      the test result xml files from surefire
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the tests have not been run yet
